unnormalised: Vaishno Devi Yatra sees record surge, pilgrims flock despite weather
normalised: Vaishno Devi Yatra sees record surge, pilgrims flock despite weather

unnormalised: The Vaishno Devi Yatra is experiencing an unprecedented surge in pilgrims this season! Despite the occasional bouts of rain and chilly weather, devotees are making their way to the holy shrine in droves. Sources say over 5 lakh (500,000) pilgrims have already visited in the past 2 months alone.
normalised: The Vaishno Devi Yatra is experiencing an unprecedented surge in pilgrims this season! Despite the occasional bouts of rain and chilly weather, devotees are making their way to the holy shrine in droves. Sources say over five lakh five hundred thousand pilgrims have already visited in the past two months alone.

unnormalised: "It's incredible to see such faith," said a local shopkeeper, Mr. Sharma. "I've been here for 10 yrs, and I haven't seen this much rush. Many are coming from states like Gujarat, Maharashtra, UP. It's good for business also. Especially around festival times like Navratri in Oct, you get a lot of sales." The Shrine Board is reportedly working overtime to ensure the smooth flow of pilgrims, including offering battery car services for senior citizens and those with disabilities.

unnormalised: The weather forecast for the upcoming week predicts moderate rainfall, but that doesn't seem to be deterring anyone. Even with the Katra to Bhawan trek being somewhat challenging (at approx 13 km), the spirit of the devotees is high. Security has been beefed up, and helipad services are fully operational. Flights from Delhi to Jammu are frequently booked solid, with tickets costing around Rs. 6000-8000.

unnormalised: Authorities are advising pilgrims to register online beforehand on the official website (maavaishnodevi.org) to avoid long queues. Also, elderly persons above 65 yrs are advised to carry medical certificates. So, if you're planning a trip, prepone it a bit, and definitely check the weather forecast beforehand. Jai Mata Di!
